title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Scorpion [Scorpio], from le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824
title_raw: Plate Design:  Le Scorpion [Scorpio], from le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, image bordered in pen and brown ink
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink over graphite, on mount, upper center:  Le Scorpion [Scorpio], lower center:  très venimeux vois plutot!/...C'est un enfant, on lui Conte/ça...[Very venemous, take heed!...He is a child, he's been told that..; in graphite, on mount, upper right:  11
description: Scene inside a house.  A woman, left of center middleground, points out a jar holding a scorpion to a young boy to her right.  Behind them, left background, partially draped with a striped fabric, are shelves holding canisters. A young girl with boy holding a hoop in his right hand, right foreground, discuss the child. A large window/door, right background, shows a view of trees.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Scorpion [Scorpio], from le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, image bordered in pen and brown ink. 
1989-13-45
